original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (5)🔽17.11. Kusalattika, Parittattika🔽Abyākataṁ parittaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naparitto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Kusalaṁ mahaggataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo namahaggato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽(Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… aññamaññe tīṇi …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma paccanīya  kusala ttika paritta ttika  abyākatam parittam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na parittaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  kusalam mahaggatam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na mahaggataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  saṅkhitta hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe aññamaññe tīṇi pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: The forward and reverse order of conditions in the Paṭṭhāna, with the subcommentary🔽The Triad of the Wholesome, the Triad of the Limited

original: Kusalaṁ appamāṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naappamāṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: kusalam appamāṇam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na appamāṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: With an unwholesome, limited, and indeterminate phenomenon as condition there arises a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon that is limited, arisen by wholesome root condition. (In brief.) With a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon as condition there arises a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon that is limited, arisen by root condition. (In brief.) With a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon as condition there arises a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon that is limited, arisen by object condition. (In brief.) With a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon as condition there arises a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon that is limited, arisen by predominance condition. (In brief.) With a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon as condition there arises a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon that is limited, arisen by proximity condition. (In brief.) With a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon as condition there arises a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon that is limited, arisen by contiguity condition. (In brief.) With a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon as condition there arises a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon that is limited, arisen by association condition. (In brief.) With a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon as condition there arises a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon that is limited, arisen by absence condition. (In brief.) With a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon as condition there arises a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon that is limited, arisen by disappearance condition. (In brief.) With a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon as condition there arises a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon that is limited, arisen by repetition condition. (In brief.) With a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon as condition there arises a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon that is limited, arisen by strong influence condition. (In brief.) With a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon as condition there arises a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon that is limited, arisen by habitual condition. (In brief.) With a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon as condition there arises a wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate phenomenon that is limited, arisen by root condition.
